intro: Bejaria coarctata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bejaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy texture. Bejaria coarctata produces small, yellowish flowers that are arranged in dense clusters, contributing to its ornamental value.
